bibl.title: Reading Aristophanes Amid the Sands of Egypt.
bibl.note: Condensed version (translated in English) of: Διαβάζοντας Αριστοφάνη στην άμμο της Αιγύπτου, Κωμικός Στέφανος. Νέες τάσεις στην έρευνα της αρχαίας ελληνικής κωμωδίας (Rethymno, 2014) pp. 155-175, 4 tabl. - Only eleven of the comedies written by the famous Athenian playwright Aristophanes have survived from Antiquity. Nevertheless, papyrus fragments unearthed from the sand of Egypt provide us with a unique way to develop a new understanding of Aristophanes and his reception.
bibl.seg: Nikos Litinas, Reading Aristophanes Amid the Sands of Egypt.

Condensed version (translated in English) of: Διαβάζοντας Αριστοφάνη στην άμμο της Αιγύπτου, Κωμικός Στέφανος. Νέες τάσεις στην έρευνα της αρχαίας ελληνικής κωμωδίας (Rethymno, 2014) pp. 155-175, 4 tabl. - Only eleven of the comedies written by the famous Athenian playwright Aristophanes have survived from Antiquity. Nevertheless, papyrus fragments unearthed from the sand of Egypt provide us with a unique way to develop a new understanding of Aristophanes and his reception.
